meanings.definition: A person who steers a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: The helmspersons carefully navigated the ship through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent2: The helmspersons on the pirate ship were skilled at steering through rough waters.
meanings.sent3: The helmspersons decided to have a race to see who could steer their boats the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of life, we are all helmspersons steering our own ships towards our goals.
meanings.sent5: The helmspersons' job is crucial as they determine the ship's direction and safety.

meanings.definition: The person in charge of guiding or directing a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: As the helmspersons of the company, they made important decisions for its future.
meanings.sent2: The helmspersons of the team led by example and inspired others to work hard.
meanings.sent3: The helmspersons organized a team-building retreat to strengthen their group's unity.
meanings.sent4: The helmspersons of the organization steered it towards success with their strategic planning.
meanings.sent5: The helmspersons' leadership skills were evident in the growth and prosperity of the group.
